content: In Greek mythology, who was the king of the gods, ruler of Mount Olympus, and god of the sky, thunder, and lightning?

In Greek mythology, the king of the gods, ruler of Mount Olympus, and god of the sky, thunder, and lightning was Zeus. He was the youngest son of the Titans Cronus and Rhea and overthrew his father to become the leader of the Olympian gods. Zeus was known for his power, wisdom, and sometimes his unpredictable nature. He was often depicted holding a lightning bolt, which was his signature weapon.
